info.game_comments: 2005 Ultimate Tournament of Champions Round 2, game 17.

(1, 1).clue: This man, the USA's first ambassador to France, has a Paris rue named for him

(3, 1).clue: In 1966 this All-Star player became the first African-American head coach in the NBA

(5, 1).clue: Le Duc Tho & this secretary of state won the Nobel Peace Prize for negotiating a Vietnam cease-fire agreement

(6, 1).clue: These phenomena are also known as tropical cyclones

(1, 2).clue: For this activity, Frommer's suggests Rome's Via Condotti, & in Paris, Rue du Faubourg St.-Honore

(2, 2).clue: "If You Love Somebody Set Them Free"(1985)

(3, 2).clue: Astronomers Henry Russell & Ejnar Hertzsprung devised a diagram displaying the luminosity of these

(5, 2).clue: Steve Ditko & this man created "The Amazing Spider-Man" comic book series

(6, 2).clue: One popular activity in Cairo cafes is smoking using this device

(1, 3).clue: Rue des Ecoles takes you right to this ecole, a name commonly used of the University of Paris

(3, 3).clue: "The Analysis of Mind" & "Marriage & Morals" are books by this thinker, grandson of a British prime minister

(5, 3).clue: Bell Atlantic & GTE merged in 2000 to form this company, then the nation's largest wireless provider

(6, 3).clue: The pagan New Year festival of Samhain evolved into this current observance

(1, 4).clue: In history, it follows "Catherine de"; near the Palais du Luxembourg, it follows "Rue de"

(3, 4).clue: Until 1931 members of this religious movement founded by Charles Russell were known as Russellites

(5, 4).clue: (Sarah of the Clue Crew reports from atop a horse.)  The cattle known as black baldies are Hereford bred with this Scottish variety

(6, 4).clue: The chief minister responsible for law & order in the United Kingdom

(1, 5).clue: Rue Jean Giraudoux connects to a rue named for this place in the title of Giraudoux' best-known work

(3, 5).clue: A collection of this New York Times columnist's work was titled "Poor Russell's Almanac"

(5, 5).clue: Alfred & Helen Free developed a "dip & read" test so diabetics could check the level of this sugar in their blood

(6, 5).clue: The government departments, jurisdiction & authority associated with the Vatican

(1, 1).clue: He commanded all the Union armies

(2, 1).clue: Monkey business abounds in this 1951 film in which Reagan co-stars with a chimp

(3, 1).clue: "Filling Station" features dancing truck drivers & this 1930s dance whose name is New York City's nickname

(4, 1).clue: In October 1959, soon after being discharged from the Marines, this American applied for Soviet citizenship

(6, 1).clue: It's commonly used to denote both a gender & a sweater size

(1, 2).clue: He taught debate & public speaking at a Houston, Texas high school

(2, 2).clue: In 1938's "Brother Rat", Reagan acted with this woman who would become his first wife

(3, 2).clue: Concubines & a eunuch are featured in the exotic ballet named for this "Arabian Nights" tale-spinner

(4, 2).clue: (Hi, this is Wayne Brady.)  Before getting his own sitcom, Andy Richter was this talk show host's sidekick for 7 years

(5, 2).clue: Jack Canfield & Mark Victor Hansen:"____ for the Soul"

(6, 2).clue: Strikeout master Roger Clemens gave all 4 of his children names starting with this letter

(1, 3).clue: He practiced law in Grand Rapids, Michigan

(2, 3).clue: In 1940's "Santa Fe Trail", co-starring Errol Flynn, Reagan played this flamboyant cavalry officer

(3, 3).clue: Tipsy revelers frolic with ladies of easy virtue in the Hogarth-inspired ballet about this man's "Progress"

(4, 3).clue: In 27 B.C. the man known as this was officially confirmed as emperor

(6, 3).clue: To begin English words that come from Greek, it can have a "Z" sound; to begin words from Chinese, a "SH" sound

(1, 4).clue: He was Tennessee's first delegate to the U.S. House of Representatives

(2, 4).clue: Reagan's last film role was as a bad guy in 1964's "The Killers", based on a short story by this man

(3, 4).clue: In an 1870 Delibes ballet, Swanilda, the heroine, gets all dolled up to impersonate this title doll

(4, 4).clue: His best known plays include "Waiting for Lefty" & "The Country Girl"

(6, 4).clue: You can find one of these chic hotels in New Orleans, Diamond Head or Mexico City

(1, 5).clue: (Cheryl of the Clue Crew reports from a desk at NYPD headquarters.)  This future U.S. president sat at this desk when he was president of the board of police commissioners

(2, 5).clue: Reagan played Bette Davis' boozing high society pal in this 1939 film about a socialite dying of a brain tumor

(3, 5).clue: 1977's "Calcium Light Night" was the first ballet choreographed by this great Dane, Ballet Master in Chief of the NYCB

(4, 5).clue: This cardinal was entombed in St. Patrick's Cathedral in May 2000

(6, 5).clue: This symbol that gauges magnetic flux density comes from the creator of the rotating magnetic field & an 1891 "coil"

(0, 0).clue: After 285 years, in 1945 this British organization inducted its first women, including Kathleen Lonsdale, seen here
